Arctic Logistics, LLC Canton Plant Risk Management Plan Executive Summary



Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled



Arctic Logistics, LLC is a cold storage facility.  Anhydrous ammonia is the only regulated substance present at the facility.  The entire anhydrous ammonia inventory is attributed to its use as a refrigerant in the ammonia refrigeration system.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Arctic Logistics, LLC is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  Our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers such areas as design, installation, operating procedures, and maintenance demonstrates this commitment, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration system.  It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of anhydrous ammonia.  Unforseeably, if such a release does occur, our highly trained refrigeration personnel are available to control and mitigate the effects of the release.  We are also completely coordinated with the Canton Fire Department and Hazmat Team, which provide additional emergency response expertise.



Worse Case Release Scenario and the Alternative Case Release Scenario



Worst-case and alternative-case release scenarios were developed using the methodology provided in the EPA's RMP Comp.  The details of the chosen scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration system are located within the Risk Management Program that is located on site.



Accidental Release Prevention and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Program



Arctic Logistics, LLC has taken all of the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements noted in 40 CFR Part 68.  Our facility is also subject to the Michigan OSHA Process Safety Management standard 29 CFR 1910.119.  Our facility is also subject to the EPA's EPCRA Section 302 notification requirements.  The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release p

revention program that is in place at our facility.



Process Safety Information



Arctic Logistics, LLC currently maintains a detailed record of written process safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment design associated with the ammonia refrigeration system.



Process Hazard Analyses



The methodology used to complete the analyses is the What-If Checklist.  The analyses are completed by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations.  The process hazard analyses are revalidated every 5 years.  Any findings related to the hazard analyses are completed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures



Arctic Logistics, LLC maintains written operating procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround.  The information is reviewed annually and is readily accessible to personnel who operate and maintain the ammonia refrigeration system.



Training



Arctic Logistics, LLC has a training program in place to train employees who are operating and maintaining the ammonia refrigeration system.  Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.



Mechanical Integrity



Arctic Logistics, LLC conducts documented maintenance and inspections and tests on process equipment to ensure it is operating and being maintained properly.  Process equipment includes pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and compressors.  Maintenance procedures are performed by qualified personnel with training and experience in maintenance practices.  Training is provided to the personnel as needed.  Any equipment deficiencies identified during maintenance checks are corrected in a timely manner.



Management of Change



Written procedures

are in place at Arctic Logistics, LLC to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures.  Process operators, maintenance personnel and all other employees whose job tasks are affected by a change in the process are promptly made aware of and offered training regarding the change.



Pre-Startup Safety Reviews



Pre-Startup Safety Reviews related to new processes and to modification of the existing process are conducted as a regular practice at Arctic Logistics, LLC.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that the construction, equipment, and operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.



Compliance Audits



Arctic Logistics, LLC conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions required by the Risk Management Planning regulation are being implemented.  These audits are carried out at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are completed in a timely manner.



Incident Investigation



Arctic Logistics, LLC promptly investigates incidents that could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of anhydrous ammonia.  These investigations are conducted to identify the conditions leading up to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent it from recurring.  All incident investigation reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.



Employee Participation



Arctic Logistics, LLC believes that process safety management and accident prevention require a team effort.  Company employees are encouraged to express their views regarding accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, our employees have access to all information collected as part of the facilities compliance with the Risk Management Planning regulation including informalltion resulting from process hazard analyses.



Contractors



On occasion, Arctic Logistics, LLC hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance

and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, and at least annually thereafter, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is conducted.  Arctic Logistics, LLC informs the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractor's work and the ammonia refrigeration system.  Contractors are also informed of all applicable procedures for emergency response to an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.



Five-Year Accident History



Arctic Logistics, LLC has an excellent record of preventing accidental releases during the history of the ammonia refrigeration system.  With continued attention to the safety and mechanical integrity of the ammonia refrigeration system, this excellent record is expected to continue.



Emergency Action Plan



Arctic Logistics, LLC has a written Emergency Action Plan to outline procedures for handling accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  The plan includes all aspect of emergency action including first-aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and notifications of local emergency response agencies and the public.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program.  Continued annual emergency evacuation training, and safety and training program reviews are some of the major actions we take to improve safety at our facility.
